intro: Cynanchum beckii, commonly known as the black swallow-wort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and range in color from white to pink. Cynanchum beckii is also known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
